tool.name: FROGS DESeq2 Preprocess
tool.description: import a Pyloseq object and prepare it for DESeq2 differential abundance analysis

param.name: data
param.label: Phyloseq object (format rdata)
param.help: This is the result of FROGS Phyloseq Import Data with normalize option set to NO (DESeq2 is more powerful on unnormalized counts).

param.name: var1
param.label: Experimental variable
param.help: ex: pH, Time, Treatment, etc. The variable suspected to have an impact on OTUs' abundances.

param.name: seconde
param.label: Do you want use a model with two variables?

param.name: mod
param.help: Choose interaction (*) only if the effect of the first variable depends on the value of the second one (e.g. if Treatment does not affect OTUs in the same way in samples of different Status).
param.label: Type of model

tool.help:
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_logo.png :height: 144 :width: 110
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Launch Rscript to compute differential abundance analysis using `DESeq2 <https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DESeq2.html>`_ on a `Phyloseq <https://joey711.github.io/phyloseq/>`_ object.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Input
**phyloseq object** (format rdata): One phyloseq object stored in a rdata file. This file is the result of FROGSSTAT Phyloseq Import Data.
.. class:: warningmark
we need unnormalized data to analyse the abundance differencies. So RData used here is the result of FROGSSTAT Phyloseq Import Data with "Normalize" option set to "NO".
.. class:: h3
Ouput
**dds object** (format rdata): A DESeq2 dataset (dds) stored in rdata file.
